article.headline: Pepperdine 87, CS Northridge 72
article.story: MALIBU, Calif. (AP) -- Mike Gerrity scored 20 points and Tashaan Forehan-Kelly had 17 points and 10 rebounds Wednesday as Pepperdine beat Cal State Northridge 87-72. Jarrad Henry added 13 points for the Waves as the team won back-to-back games for the first time this season. Pepperdine (4-7) had a double-digit lead for most of the second half, getting a boost from 9-of-16 shooting from beyond the 3-point line. The Waves built their biggest advantage, a 16-point lead, when Forehan-Kelly sank two free throws with 1:44 remaining. Thomas Shewmake had a career-high 22 points, Calvin Chitwood scored 17 and Mike Efevberha added 16 for Cal State Northridge. The Matadors (5-4) hit 23 of 31 free throws but connected on only five 3-pointers on 21 attempts.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
